webdriver_test_tools.webdriver.actions.form module¶

Functions for interacting with forms

webdriver_test_tools.webdriver.actions.form.fill_form_inputs(driver, form_element, input_name_map)[source]¶

Takes a dictionary mapping input names to the desired values and fill out the form accordingly

Iterates through input_name_map and calls fill_form_input() to handle filling in the input based on its type

Parameters:
  • driver – Selenium webdriver object (largely for scrolling into view)
  • form_element – The Selenium WebElement for the form or container with the desired inputs. Used for locating the input elements by name in case there are other elements on the page with the same name attribute
  • input_name_map – A dictionary mapping the name of the input to the value to set it to. See the documentation for fill_form_input() for value types for the different inputs.
webdriver_test_tools.webdriver.actions.form.fill_form_input(driver, form_element, name, value)[source]¶

Takes the name and value of a form input and determines what type it is to fill it appropriately.

Parameters:
  • driver – Selenium webdriver object (largely for scrolling clickable inputs into view)
  • form_element – The Selenium WebElement for the form or container with the desired inputs. Used for locating the input elements by name in case there are other elements on the page with the same name attribute
  • name – The name attribute of the input
  • value –

    The desired value to set the input to.

    • For checkbox elements, this value should be a boolean (True=checked, False=unchecked).
    • For radio elements, this should be the value attribute of the radio to select.
    • For single select elements, this value should be the value of the option to select.
    • For multiple select elements, this value should be a list of values of the options to select.
    • For file inputs, this value should be a filepath to the desired file.
    • For other input types (text, number, etc) this should be a string representation of the values to enter into it.
webdriver_test_tools.webdriver.actions.form.select_radio_input(driver, form_element, name, value)[source]¶

Selects a radio input with the specified name and value attributes

Parameters:
  • driver – Selenium webdriver object. Used for scrolling the element into view before clicking element
  • form_element – The Selenium WebElement for the form or container with the desired inputs. Used for locating the input elements by name in case there are other elements on the page with the same name attribute
  • name – Name attribute of the radio input(s)
  • value – Value attribute of the radio input to select
webdriver_test_tools.webdriver.actions.form.toggle_checkbox_input(driver, checkbox_element, value)[source]¶

Set the checked state of a checkbox input

First checks if the checkbox value doesn’t match the desired value. If not, it then checks if element is visible. If it is, scroll to it and click it. If it isn’t, it tries to find a label for the element by getting the element id and selecting a label with that id as the for attribute. If it finds one, it scrolls to that and clicks it.

Parameters:
  • driver – Selenium webdriver object. Used for scrolling the element into view before clicking element
  • checkbox_element – WebElement for the checkbox to toggle
  • value – True to ensure box is checked, False to ensure it’s unchecked
webdriver_test_tools.webdriver.actions.form.fill_field_input(input_element, value, clear_current_value=False)[source]¶

Fill an input that is normally typed into (e.g. inputs of type text, password, number, etc)

Parameters:
  • input_element – WebElement for the input
  • value – String of key presses to simulate using the send_keys() function
  • clear_current_value – (Default = False) If True, clear out any existing value in the input before entering the new one
webdriver_test_tools.webdriver.actions.form.select_option(select_element, value)[source]¶

Select an option in a select element

Parameters:
  • select_element – WebElement for the select input
  • value – Value of the option to select
webdriver_test_tools.webdriver.actions.form.select_multiple_options(select_element, values, clear_current_selection=False)[source]¶

Select options in a multiple select element

Parameters:
  • select_element – WebElement for the select input
  • values – List of values of the options to select
  • clear_current_selection – (Default = False) If True, deselect all currently selected options before selection the new ones
webdriver_test_tools.webdriver.actions.form.get_form_input_values(form_element, input_names=None)[source]¶

Returns a dictionary mapping input names to their current values

Parameters:
  • form_element – WebElement for the form or container where the inputs are located. Alternatively, a WebDriver element can be used to retrieve all inputs on the current page.
  • input_names – (Optional) List of input names to get the values of. If provided, only elements whose names are listed will be checked
Returns:

Dictionary mapping input names to their current values. See the documentation for the value parameter of fill_form_input() for value types of different inputs.
webdriver_test_tools.webdriver.actions.form.get_form_input_value(input_element)[source]¶

Returns the value of an input

This function contains the logic to determine what kind of input this is and uses the appropriate function to retrieve its value

Parameters:input_element – WebElement for the input
Returns:The value of the input
webdriver_test_tools.webdriver.actions.form.get_radio_value(input_element)[source]¶

Get the value of a radio input (if it’s selected)

Parameters:input_element – WebElement for the input
Returns:The value attribute of the radio button if input_element is selected, None if it’s not selected
webdriver_test_tools.webdriver.actions.form.get_checkbox_value(input_element)[source]¶

Get the value of a checkbox input

Parameters:input_element – WebElement for the input
Returns:True if element is checked, False if it’s unchecked
webdriver_test_tools.webdriver.actions.form.get_field_value(input_element)[source]¶

Get the value of a text input or similar input type (number, password, etc)

Parameters:input_element – WebElement for the input
Returns:Value of the input
webdriver_test_tools.webdriver.actions.form.get_select_value(input_element)[source]¶

Get the value of the selected option in a single select element

Parameters:input_element – WebElement for the input
Returns:The value attribute of the selected option
webdriver_test_tools.webdriver.actions.form.get_select_multiple_values(input_element)[source]¶

Get the values of the selected options in a multiple select element

Parameters:input_element – WebElement for the input
Returns:List containing the value attribute of the selected options
